title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Persons Who Commit, Threaten To Commit, or Support Terrorism
summary: The document is a presidential notice from September 8, 2025, announcing the continuation of the national emergency with respect to terrorism, initially declared on September 23, 2001, by Executive Order 13224. The notice highlights the ongoing threat posed by international terrorism and the need to maintain the emergency measures to address this threat. The President extends the national emergency for another year, citing the continued unusual and extraordinary threat to national security, foreign policy, and the economy of the United States. The notice is published in the Federal Register and transmitted to Congress.
